item.title: How to squash a commit in git
item.description: If you are working on a project in Github, your work isn’t always linear. Sometimes the change you make doesn’t work completely, so you back a little bit of it out and move forward on a next part. It may take some hacking and sawing (and testing of course) to get a change that just works right. Projects like to have contributions, but project maintainers don’t like to insert noise into their efforts.
